Something silly I noticed just now digging around stats. Wes Matthews minutes-per-game averages, year-by-year, since 2010-11: 33.6, 33.8, 34.8, 33.9, 33.7, 33.9, 34.2, 33.8, 33.6. I mean...that is almost uncanny

De'Aaron Fox's passing has been one of the most exciting parts of the early season. The pace and extra spacing w/ Bjelica at PF helps, but he's just seeing and making really high-level passes that weren't in his game last season. Super impressive.
Some of these Minnesota turnovers in crunch-time last night are straight-up absurd. Not sure what would happen if the Wolves and Wizards played each other right now.
Deal includes both Robert Covington and Dario Saric, sources tell ESPN

A max for Butler would raise obvious questions about Fultz's long-term place in Philly, though there are lots of other Fultz questions to answer first. Philly will watch very carefully to see how all the personalities mesh.

Time will tell if Jimmy is the right specific target, and on how his next contract ages, but in theory, you cash in Saric and Covington for a player at Butler's level. We'll see how the shooting/chemistry/fit questions develop. Top of the East is a whole lot of fun.

Kawhi and PG-13 are much cleaner fits with the Sixers than Jimmy is, but neither appears to have been available to Philly at this price or (in PG's case) in free agency last summer. You either wait another year for a better fit, or pay this price for Jimmy. Interesting choices.

Have been working on a LeVert feature. I can't overstate how much the Nets love him as a person almost even more than as a player. Interviewed him twice, certainly seems like a great guy. They consider him the keystone of what they are building. Just a devastating injury.
What Caris LeVert means to the Nets: https://t.co/gIsKYWLA6V

This was very much NOT the story I planned to write. The original story was not even just about Caris.  And these are certainly the last circumstances under which I ever wanted to write about any player. https://t.co/gIsKYWLA6V

Have the Grizzlies and Jazz played 17 times already? And would you support them playing 17 more just so we can throw in some games in the 90s and even the 80s?
Wild, random stat: Only 5% of Clippers shots have been corner 3s, 2nd-lowest in league. They have made 56% (!!!!) of them, tops by a mile.
